required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Phase II Trial of Neo-Adjuvant Pemetrexed Plus Cisplatin Followed by Surgery and Radiation for Pleural Mesothelioma
clinical_study.official_title: A Multicenter Phase II Trial of Neo-Adjuvant Pemetrexed (Alimta) Plus Cisplatin Followed by Surgery and Radiation for Pleural Mesothelioma

brief_summary.textblock: This study aims to determine how successful the chemotherapy regimen of Pemetrexed plus cisplatin before surgery is at killing all the tumor so that none is left at the time of surgery. Following surgery, all eligible patients will receive radiation to the chest. How patients respond, whether the cancer returns and if so, where, will also be monitored.

primary_outcome.time_frame: Surgery (at least 3 weeks post last dose of chemotherapy, up to a maximum interval of 8 weeks)

secondary_outcome.measure: The 1 and 2 Year Disease-Free Survival Rate (Percentage)

secondary_outcome.time_frame: baseline to date of death from any cause

arm_group.description: chemotherapy, surgery then chest radiation x 54 gray (Gy)

intervention.description: 500 mg/m2, intravenous (IV), every 21 days x 4 cycles
75 mg/m2, intravenous (IV), every 21 days x 4 cycles

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Patients will be clinically staged using AJCC/UICC TNM staging criteria. Eligible stages:
1. Patients must be M0
2. Patients with T1, T2, and T3 disease (without cardiac involvement) are eligible (T status can be established clinically and radiologically or at exploratory thoracotomy without surgical resection
3. Patients with N0, N1,or N2 disease are eligible
- Performance status of 0 to 1 on the ECOG performance status schedule.
- No prior systemic chemotherapy and no prior intracavitary cytotoxic drugs or immunomodulators, unless given for the purpose of chemical pleurodesis
- No previous radiation therapy
- Estimated life expectancy of at least 12 weeks
Exclusion Criteria:
Patients will be excluded if they meet ANY of the following criteria:
- Have received treatment within the last 30 days with a drug that has not received regulatory approval for any indication at the time of study entry
- Have previously completed or withdrawn from this study or any other study investigating pemetrexed
- Pregnancy or breast-feeding
- Serious concomitant systemic disorders (i.e. active infection) that, in the opinion of the investigator, would compromise the safety of the patient or compromise the patient's ability to complete the study
- Second active primary malignancy (except in situ carcinoma of the cervix, adequately treated non-melanomatous carcinoma of the skin, low grade (Gleason score less than or equal to 6), localized adenocarcinoma of the prostate or other malignancy treated at least 2 years previously with no evidence of recurrence

group.title: Pemetrexed
group.description: pemetrexed: 500 mg/m2, intravenous, every 21 days x 4 cycles cisplatin: 75 mg/m2, intravenous, every 21 days x 4 cycles chemotherapy, surgery then chest radiation x 54 gray (Gy)

group.title: Pemetrexed
group.description: pemetrexed: 500 mg/m2, intravenous, every 21 days x 4 cycles cisplatin: 75 mg/m2, intravenous, every 21 days x 4 cycles chemotherapy, surgery then chest radiation x 54 gray (Gy)

measure.title: Disease Stage at Time of Study Entry
Eastern Cooperative Oncology Group Performance Status
Time from Initial Pathological Diagnosis to Enrollment

outcome.title: Pathological Complete Response
outcome.description: Number of participants with results of pathological review that indicated a complete response. Pathological complete response should be evaluated at the time of surgery (Extrapleural Pneumonectomy [EPP]). Resected tissue or pleural fluid should be sent for pathological and histological evaluation.
outcome.time_frame: Surgery (at least 3 weeks post last dose of chemotherapy, up to a maximum interval of 8 weeks)
outcome.population: All participants who had undergone surgery.

group.title: Pemetrexed
group.description: pemetrexed: 500 mg/m2, intravenous, every 21 days x 4 cycles cisplatin: 75 mg/m2, intravenous, every 21 days x 4 cycles chemotherapy, surgery then chest radiation x 54 gray (Gy)

measure.title: Pathological Complete Response
measure.description: Number of participants with results of pathological review that indicated a complete response. Pathological complete response should be evaluated at the time of surgery (Extrapleural Pneumonectomy [EPP]). Resected tissue or pleural fluid should be sent for pathological and histological evaluation.
measure.population: All participants who had undergone surgery.

outcome.title: The 1 and 2 Year Disease-Free Survival Rate (Percentage)
outcome.description: Kaplan-Meier estimates of the percentage of participants still alive at 1-year and 2-years, based upon the total number of participants who had surgery.
outcome.population: All participants who had undergone surgery.

group.title: Pemetrexed
group.description: pemetrexed: 500 mg/m2, intravenous, every 21 days x 4 cycles cisplatin: 75 mg/m2, intravenous, every 21 days x 4 cycles chemotherapy, surgery then chest radiation x 54 gray (Gy)

measure.title: The 1 and 2 Year Disease-Free Survival Rate (Percentage)
measure.description: Kaplan-Meier estimates of the percentage of participants still alive at 1-year and 2-years, based upon the total number of participants who had surgery.
measure.population: All participants who had undergone surgery.

outcome.title: Overall Tumor Response
outcome.description: The frequency of best overall tumor response summarized by response category. The best (unconfirmed) response recorded from the start of chemotherapy treatment until disease progression/recurrence, start of any further anti-tumor therapy, or time of surgery whichever comes first.
outcome.population: Intention to Treat analysis. All enrolled participants who were eligible for the treatment, whether or not they received the study drug.

group.title: Pemetrexed
group.description: pemetrexed: 500 mg/m2, intravenous, every 21 days x 4 cycles cisplatin: 75 mg/m2, intravenous, every 21 days x 4 cycles chemotherapy, surgery then chest radiation x 54 gray (Gy)

measure.title: Overall Tumor Response
measure.description: The frequency of best overall tumor response summarized by response category. The best (unconfirmed) response recorded from the start of chemotherapy treatment until disease progression/recurrence, start of any further anti-tumor therapy, or time of surgery whichever comes first.
measure.population: Intention to Treat analysis. All enrolled participants who were eligible for the treatment, whether or not they received the study drug.

outcome.title: Time to Treatment Failure
outcome.description: Time to relapse (treatment failure) is measured in months and calculated as (Date of first surgery - Date of first relapse after surgery + 1)/(365.25/12). Time to relapse will be censored at the date of the last visit or start date of further anti-tumor therapy or intervention, whichever comes first.
outcome.population: All participants who had undergone surgery.

group.title: Pemetrexed
group.description: pemetrexed: 500 mg/m2, intravenous, every 21 days x 4 cycles cisplatin: 75 mg/m2, intravenous, every 21 days x 4 cycles chemotherapy, surgery then chest radiation x 54 gray (Gy)

measure.title: Time to Treatment Failure
measure.description: Time to relapse (treatment failure) is measured in months and calculated as (Date of first surgery - Date of first relapse after surgery + 1)/(365.25/12). Time to relapse will be censored at the date of the last visit or start date of further anti-tumor therapy or intervention, whichever comes first.
measure.population: All participants who had undergone surgery.

outcome.title: Time to Progressive Disease
outcome.description: Number of months between the first dose date and the date of first disease progression or death as a result of any cause, whichever comes first.
outcome.population: All participants who had undergone surgery.

group.title: Pemetrexed
group.description: pemetrexed: 500 mg/m2, intravenous, every 21 days x 4 cycles cisplatin: 75 mg/m2, intravenous, every 21 days x 4 cycles chemotherapy, surgery then chest radiation x 54 gray (Gy)

measure.title: Time to Progressive Disease
measure.description: Number of months between the first dose date and the date of first disease progression or death as a result of any cause, whichever comes first.
measure.population: All participants who had undergone surgery.

outcome.title: Overall Survival Time
outcome.description: Number of months between the first dose date and the date of death as a result of any cause. Overall survival time calculated as (Date of death - First dose date + 1)/(365.25/12).
outcome.time_frame: baseline to date of death from any cause
outcome.population: All participants who had undergone surgery.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: The only disclosure restriction on the PI is that the sponsor can review results communications prior to public release and can embargo communications regarding trial results for a period that is more than 60 days but less than or equal to 180 days. The sponsor cannot require changes to the communication and cannot extend the embargo.
